my-account-wp-connect.MESSAGE_SUBMIT: Once you hit submit we'll try to connect to your blog.
my-account-wp-connect.MESSAGE_SYNC_DETAIL: If the connection succeeds, we'll begin the comment sync. We'll securely "download" the comments from your blog, and then make sure any new comments are synced across both systems.

my-account-wp-sso-enable.HEADING: WordPress SSO
my-account-wp-sso-enable.MESSAGE_LAST_STEP: One last step! Just click "Enable SSO" to enable single-sign-on on your blog.
my-account-wp-sso-enable.MESSAGE_DESCRIPTION: We'll create an API secret key for you, securely send it over to your blog, and then tell your blog to enable SSO. This is safe to run as many times as you like in the event that you run into issues. If this process fails we'll automatically get notified, however feel free to also contact support.
my-account-wp-sso-enable.MESSAGE_DURATION: You can expect this process to only take a few seconds.
my-account-wp-sso-enable.MESSAGE_IN_PROGRESS: Hold on tight. We just need to create a secret API key and update your blog's settings.
my-account-wp-sso-enable.MESSAGE_AFTER_DONE: After this is done users will use your WordPress sign in flow to use FastComments.

my-account-wp-sync.HEADING: WordPress Connect
my-account-wp-sync.MESSAGE_IMPORTING: We're currently importing your comments so we can serve them from your blog. You can keep this page open if you want, or you can close it and we'll email you when this is done. If you want to come back later and check the status, simply click the Import/Export button at the top.
my-account-wp-sync.MESSAGE_AFTER_DONE: After this is done we'll keep your comments in sync with your WordPress site so if you ever deactivate FastComments you won't lose any data.

privacy-policy.DESCRIPTION: FastComments is part of WinrickLabs LLC. This privacy policy will explain how our organization (WinrickLabs LLC) uses the personal data we collect from you when you use our website.
privacy-policy.TOPIC_1: Commenters: What data do we collect?
privacy-policy.TOPIC_2: Our Customers: What data do we collect?
privacy-policy.TOPIC_3: How do we collect your data?
privacy-policy.TOPIC_4: How will we use your data?
privacy-policy.TOPIC_5: How do we store your data?
privacy-policy.TOPIC_6: Where do we store your data?
privacy-policy.TOPIC_9: What are your data protection rights?
privacy-policy.TOPIC_12: What types of cookies do we use?
privacy-policy.TOPIC_17: How to contact the appropriate authorities
privacy-policy.HEADING_COMMENTERS_DATA: Commenters: What data do we collect?
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_COMMENTERS_INTRO: When you comment with FastComments, WinrickLabs LLC collects the following data:
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_NO_THIRD_PARTY: We do not share this information with any third parties or use it for any form of solicitation.
privacy-policy.HEADING_CUSTOMERS_DATA: Our Customers: What data do we collect?
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_CUSTOMERS_INTRO: When you become a customer, WinrickLabs LLC collects the following data via FastComments:
privacy-policy.NOTE_NO_STORE_CC: *We do not store this information. However, we do share it with Stripe for payment processing.
privacy-policy.NOTE_IP_HASHING: **We do not store raw IP Addresses of those that comment, or use FastComments as a discussion platform. We hash those ip addresses with a salt for administration features. Tenants can opt out of this behavior.
privacy-policy.NOTE_NO_TENANT_ACCESS: In no way do our tenants have access to your IP Address or the hashed version.
privacy-policy.NOTE_ENTERPRISE_LOGGING: For Enterprise customers, or those with the Audit Log feature, administrative actions do result in IP addresses being logged based on your requirements.
privacy-policy.HEADING_HOW_COLLECT: How do we collect your data?
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_HOW_COLLECT: We collect data and process data when you:
privacy-policy.COLLECT_1: Comment and provide your email. Some sites allow anonymous commenting. *In this case we do not collect any personal information.*
privacy-policy.COLLECT_3: Use or view our website via your browser's cookies.
privacy-policy.HEADING_HOW_USE: How will we use your data?
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_HOW_USE: WinrickLabs LLC collects your data so that FastComments can:
privacy-policy.USE_1: Process your subscription and manage your account.
privacy-policy.USE_2: Send you notifications and account alerts.
privacy-policy.USE_3: Send you an email to ask for a review.
privacy-policy.USE_3_DETAIL: We will share your email with TrustPilot, who will send up to two follow up emails and no more. Reach out to support if you'd like to create an account without sharing your email with TrustPilot.
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_STRIPE: When FastComments processes your subscription request we send your data to Stripe for payment processing.
privacy-policy.HEADING_HOW_STORE: How do we store your data?
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_STORE_1: FastComments goes go great lengths to store as little information as possible. We may not store any information that can tie a comment to you as an individual (unless you use a username that makes such a thing obvious).
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_STORE_2: Some of our customers, which we refer to as tenants, require us to store a hashed version of your IP Address for our moderation tools. We combine the IP with a secure salt before hashing.
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_STORE_3: We store all information in our secured infrastructure hosted by Hetzner and OVH. All data is encrypted at rest via LUKS.
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_STORE_4: Each region has live backups (usually within a second) to another region/country and hosting provider. For example if our US deployment is primarily on OVH, we have a live backup on Hetzner in Finland.
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_STORE_5: If you comment with your email on a site that uses FastComments, FastComments will retain your email indefinitely to send you notifications. However, you can delete this information by either entering a bogus information as an email in the account edit page or by deleting your account.
privacy-policy.HEADING_WHERE_STORE: Where do we store your data?
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_WHERE_1: FastComments is a multi-region SaaS product. As such, we are expected to have availability and serve data close to our customers.
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_WHERE_2: For most of our customers, their account, and their user's comments, are replicated globally across multiple datacenters.
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_WHERE_3: In the case of the EU, or accounts created from eu.fastcomments.com, that data stays in the EU. It is not replicated to any other regions.
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_WHERE_4: EU tenants also use the EU equivalent data processors to keep account related information in the EU.
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_PROCESSORS: FastComments uses the following data processors:
privacy-policy.PROCESSOR_MAILGUN: Mailgun (one of our email service providers)
privacy-policy.PROCESSOR_SENDINBLUE: Sendinblue (one of our email service providers)
privacy-policy.PROCESSOR_OPENAI: OpenAI (for spam detection and image content moderation, if a tenant opts-in to these features)
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_MARKETING: We currently do not use any of the information you provide for marketing purposes.
privacy-policy.HEADING_RIGHTS: What are you data protection rights?
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_RIGHTS_INTRO: WinrickLabs LLC would like to make sure you are fully aware of all your data protection rights. Every user is entitled to the following:
privacy-policy.RIGHT_ACCESS: The right to access - You have the right to request WinrickLabs LLC for copies of your personal data.
privacy-policy.RIGHT_RECTIFICATION: The right to rectification - You have the right to request WinrickLabs LLC correct any information you believe is inaccurate. You also have the right to request WinrickLabs LLC to complete information you believe is incomplete.
privacy-policy.RIGHT_ERASURE: The right to erasure - You have the right to request that WinrickLabs LLC erase your personal data.
privacy-policy.RIGHT_RESTRICT: The right to restrict processing - You have the right to request that WinrickLabs LLC restrict the processing of your personal data.
privacy-policy.RIGHT_OBJECT: The right to object to processing - You have the right to object to WinrickLabs LLC's processing of your personal data, under certain conditions.
privacy-policy.RIGHT_PORTABILITY: The right to data portability - You have the right to request that WinrickLabs LLC transfer the data that we have collected to another organization, or directly to you, under certain conditions.
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_REQUEST_RESPONSE: If you make a request, we have one month to respond to you. If you would like to exercise any of these rights, please contact us at our email:
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_COOKIES_1: Cookies are text files placed on your computer to collect standard Internet log information and visitor behavior information. When you visit sites that use FastComments, or the FastComments admin or marketing site, we use cookies to identify and authenticate you.
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_COOKIES_2: For further information, visit allaboutcookies.org.
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_USE_COOKIES_INTRO: WinrickLabs LLC uses cookies on FastComments in a range of ways to improve your experience on our site and sites that use FastComments, including:
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_BILLING_COOKIES: For Billing Administrators, FastComments uses Cookies for the following additional functionality:
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_MARKETING_COOKIES: Additionally, for our marketing site only, WinrickLabs LLC uses tracking cookies on FastComments to:
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_NO_INSTALL_COOKIES: These cookies are not in use when you install FastComments on your website. In that case, FastComments will only save a cookie on the user's device for authentication, and no other reason.
privacy-policy.HEADING_COOKIE_TYPES: What types of cookies do we use?
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_COOKIE_TYPES: There are a number of different types of cookies. When you comment with FastComments, we use only the following types of cookies:
privacy-policy.COOKIE_TYPE_FUNCTIONALITY: Functionality - WinrickLabs LLC uses these cookies so that we recognize you on our website and our customer's websites. This way we can make the commenting experience much easier. Only first party cookies are used.
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_MANAGE_COOKIES: You can set your browser not to accept cookies, and the above website tells you how to remove cookies from your browser. However, in a few cases, some of our website features may not function as a result.
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_OTHER_POLICIES: The FastComments website may contain links to other websites. Our privacy policy applies only to our website, so if you click on a link to another website, you should read their privacy policy.
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_POLICY_CHANGES: WinrickLabs LLC keeps its privacy policy under regular review and places any updates on this web page. This privacy policy was last updated on November 10th 2025.
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_CONTACT_US: If you have any questions about the WinrickLabs LLC's privacy policy, the data we hold on you, or you would like to exercise one of your data protection rights, please do not hesitate to contact us.
privacy-policy.HEADING_CONTACT_AUTHORITY: How to contact the appropriate authority
privacy-policy.MESSAGE_CONTACT_AUTHORITY: Should you wish to report a complaint or if you feel the need that WinrickLabs LLC has not addressed your concern in a satisfactory manner, you may contact the Information Commissioner's Office here.

product-demo-collab-chat.DESCRIPTION: Add discussions to any text content. Create interactive annotations on your content.
product-demo-collab-chat.MESSAGE_INTRO_1: FastComments Collab Chat provides users with the ability to create a discussion and annotate any piece of text. Simply highlight a few words, or paragraph, and start a discussion.
product-demo-collab-chat.MESSAGE_INTRO_2: You also might want to checkout Collab Chat in use by Govscent.org!
product-demo-collab-chat.TEXT_SOLAR_1: The Solar System is the gravitationally bound system of the Sun and the objects that orbit it. It formed 4.6 billion years ago from the gravitational collapse of a giant interstellar molecular cloud. The vast majority (99.86%) of the system's mass is in the Sun, with most of the remaining mass contained in the planet Jupiter. The planetary system around the Sun contains eight planets. The four inner system planets—Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars—are terrestrial planets, being composed primarily of rock and metal. The four giant planets of the outer system are substantially larger and more massive than the terrestrials. The two largest, Jupiter and Saturn, are gas giants, being composed mainly of hydrogen and helium; the next two, Uranus and Neptune, are ice giants, being composed mostly of volatile substances with relatively high melting points compared with hydrogen and helium, such as water, ammonia, and methane. All eight planets have nearly circular orbits that lie near the plane of Earth's orbit, called the ecliptic.
product-demo-collab-chat.TEXT_SOLAR_2: There are an unknown number of smaller dwarf planets and innumerable small Solar System bodies orbiting the Sun. Six of the major planets, the six largest possible dwarf planets, and many of the smaller bodies are orbited by natural satellites, commonly called "moons" after Earth's Moon. Two natural satellites, Jupiter's moon Ganymede and Saturn's moon Titan, are larger than Mercury, the smallest terrestrial planet, though less massive, and Jupiter's moon Callisto is nearly as large. Each of the giant planets and some smaller bodies are encircled by planetary rings of ice, dust and moonlets. The asteroid belt, which lies between the orbits of Mars and Jupiter, contains objects composed of rock, metal and ice. Beyond Neptune's orbit lie the Kuiper belt and scattered disc, which are populations of objects composed mostly of ice and rock.
product-demo-collab-chat.TEXT_SOLAR_3: In the outer reaches of the Solar System lies a class of minor planets called detached objects. There is considerable debate as to how many such objects there will prove to be. Some of these objects are large enough to have rounded under their own gravity and thus to be categorized as dwarf planets. Astronomers generally accept about nine objects as dwarf planets: the asteroid Ceres, the Kuiper-belt objects Pluto, Orcus, Haumea, Quaoar, and Makemake, and the scattered-disc objects Gonggong, Eris, and Sedna. Various small-body populations, including comets, centaurs and interplanetary dust clouds, freely travel between the regions of the Solar System.
product-demo-collab-chat.TEXT_SOLAR_4: The solar wind, a stream of charged particles flowing outwards from the Sun, creates a bubble-like region of interplanetary medium in the interstellar medium known as the heliosphere. The heliopause is the point at which pressure from the solar wind is equal to the opposing pressure of the interstellar medium; it extends out to the edge of the scattered disc. The Oort cloud, which is thought to be the source for long-period comets, may also exist at a distance roughly a thousand times further than the heliosphere. The Solar System is located 26,000 light-years from the center of the Milky Way galaxy in the Orion Arm, which contains most of the visible stars in the night sky. The nearest stars are within the so-called Local Bubble, with the closest, Proxima Centauri, at 4.2441 light-years.
product-demo-collab-chat.TEXT_STRUCTURE_1: The word solar means "pertaining to the Sun", which is derived from the Latin word sol, meaning Sun. The Sun is the dominant gravitational member of the Solar System, and its planetary system is maintained in a relatively stable, slowly evolving state by following isolated, gravitationally bound orbits around the Sun.
product-demo-collab-chat.TEXT_ORBITS_1: The planets and other large objects in orbit around the Sun lie near the plane of Earth's orbit, known as the ecliptic. Smaller icy objects such as comets frequently orbit at significantly greater angles to this plane. Most of the planets in the Solar System have secondary systems of their own, being orbited by natural satellites called moons. Many of the largest natural satellites are in synchronous rotation, with one face permanently turned toward their parent. The four giant planets have planetary rings, thin bands of tiny particles that orbit them in unison.
product-demo-collab-chat.TEXT_ORBITS_2: As a result of the formation of the Solar System, planets and most other objects orbit the Sun in the same direction that the Sun is rotating. That is, counter-clockwise, as viewed from above Earth's north pole. There are exceptions, such as Halley's Comet. Most of the larger moons orbit their planets in prograde direction, matching the planetary rotation; Neptune's moon Triton is the largest to orbit in the opposite, retrograde manner. Most larger objects rotate around their own axes in the prograde direction relative to their orbit, though the rotation of Venus is retrograde.
product-demo-collab-chat.TEXT_ORBITS_3: To a good first approximation, Kepler's laws of planetary motion describe the orbits of objects about the Sun. These laws stipulate that each object travels along an ellipse with the Sun at one focus, which causes the body's distance from the Sun to vary over the course of its year. A body's closest approach to the Sun is called its perihelion, whereas its most distant point from the Sun is called its aphelion.: 9-6  The orbits of the planets are nearly circular, but many comets, asteroids, and Kuiper belt objects follow highly elliptical orbits. Kepler's laws only account for the influence of the Sun's gravity upon an orbiting body, not the gravitational pulls of different bodies upon each other. On a human time scale, these additional perturbations can be accounted for using numerical models,: 9-6  but the planetary system can change chaotically over billions of years.
product-demo-collab-chat.TEXT_ORBITS_4: The angular momentum of the Solar System is a measure of the total amount of orbital and rotational momentum possessed by all its moving components. Although the Sun dominates the system by mass, it accounts for only about 2% of the angular momentum. The planets, dominated by Jupiter, account for most of the rest of the angular momentum due to the combination of their mass, orbit, and distance from the Sun, with a possibly significant contribution from comets.
product-demo-collab-chat.TEXT_COMPOSITION_1: The overall structure of the charted regions of the Solar System consists of the Sun, four smaller inner planets surrounded by a belt of mostly rocky asteroids, and four giant planets surrounded by the Kuiper belt of mostly icy objects. Astronomers sometimes informally divide this structure into separate regions. The inner Solar System includes the four terrestrial planets and the asteroid belt. The outer Solar System is beyond the asteroids, including the four giant planets. Since the discovery of the Kuiper belt, the outermost parts of the Solar System are considered a distinct region consisting of the objects beyond Neptune.
product-demo-collab-chat.TEXT_COMPOSITION_2: The principal component of the Solar System is the Sun, a low-mass star that contains 99.86% of the system's known mass and dominates it gravitationally. The Sun's four largest orbiting bodies, the giant planets, account for 99% of the remaining mass, with Jupiter and Saturn together comprising more than 90%. The remaining objects of the Solar System (including the four terrestrial planets, the dwarf planets, moons, asteroids, and comets) together comprise less than 0.002% of the Solar System's total mass.
product-demo-collab-chat.TEXT_COMPOSITION_3: The Sun is composed of roughly 98% hydrogen and helium, as are Jupiter and Saturn. A composition gradient exists in the Solar System, created by heat and light pressure from the early Sun; those objects closer to the Sun, which are more affected by heat and light pressure, are composed of elements with high melting points. Objects farther from the Sun are composed largely of materials with lower melting points. The boundary in the Solar System beyond which those volatile substances could coalesce is known as the frost line, and it lies at roughly five times the Earth's distance from the Sun.
product-demo-collab-chat.TEXT_COMPOSITION_4: The objects of the inner Solar System are composed mostly of rocky materials, such as silicates, iron or nickel. Jupiter and Saturn are composed mainly of gases with extremely low melting points and high vapour pressure, such as hydrogen, helium, and neon. Ices, like water, methane, ammonia, hydrogen sulfide, and carbon dioxide, have melting points up to a few hundred kelvins. They can be found as ices, liquids, or gases in various places in the Solar System. Icy substances comprise the majority of the satellites of the giant planets, as well as most of Uranus and Neptune (the so-called "ice giants") and the numerous small objects that lie beyond Neptune's orbit. Together, gases and ices are referred to as volatiles.

profile-comment-awaiting-approval.SUBJECT: Profile comment from <%= comment.commenterName %> awaiting approval

comment-user-mention.SUBJECT: You've been tagged in a comment.

commenter-comment-notification.PAST_HOUR_COMMENT_COUNT: In the past hour you've had <% if(replyCount > 1) { %>some replies<% } else { %>a reply<% } %> to your<% if(commentsSummary.length > 1) {%> comments<% } else { %> comment<% } %>.

commenter-comment-notification.REPLY_BY_EMAIL_TIP: You can reply to this email directly to post your response.

commenter-verify-post.SUBJECT: <%= comment.commenterName %> - Verify your comment.
commenter-verify-post.LOOKS_LIKE_YOU_COMMENTED_HERE: This is an automated email. It looks like you commented on a post here. If you click the verification link below, it'll help us know that it was you that left this comment.
commenter-verify-post.WASNT_YOU_OR_REGRET: If this wasn't you or you regret what you said ignore this email and the comment will be removed in <%= removedInDays %> days.
commenter-verify-post.REMOVE_COMMENT: Remove This Comment

commenter-verify-vote.SUBJECT: <%= commenterName %> - Verify your Vote.
commenter-verify-vote.LOOKS_LIKE_YOU_VOTED_HERE: It looks like you voted on a post here. If you click the verification link below, it'll help us know that it was you that left this vote.
commenter-verify-vote.WAS_YOU_IGNORE_THIS_EMAIL: If this wasn't you then ignore this email.

commenter-welcome-from-comment.SUBJECT: Welcome to FastComments <%= comment.commenterName %>!
commenter-welcome-from-comment.LOOKS_LIKE_YOU_COMMENTED_HERE: It looks like you commented on a post here.
commenter-welcome-from-comment.YOU_CAN_CREATE_LOGIN_LINKS_HERE: You can create new links to log into your account here.
commenter-welcome-from-comment.WASNT_YOU_OR_REGRET: If this wasn't you or you regret what you said ignore this email and the comment will be removed in <%= removedInDays %> days.

tenant-deactivated.SUBJECT: Your FastComments Tenant Has Been Deactivated
tenant-deactivated.DETAILS_LINE_ONE: This is an automated email. We see that you have had outstanding invoices for some time, and have not been able to reach you. Your account has now been deactivated.
tenant-deactivated.DETAILS_LINE_TWO: No data has been deleted. You can always re-activate your account here.

tenant-deactivated-soon.SUBJECT: Your FastComments Tenant Will Be Deactivated Soon!
tenant-deactivated-soon.DETAILS_LINE_ONE: This is an automated email. We see that you have had outstanding invoices for some time, and have not been able to reach you.
tenant-deactivated-soon.DETAILS_LINE_TWO: Your account will be deactivated on <%= readableDeactivationDate %>. You can update your billing information here.

tenant-deactivation-cancelled.SUBJECT: Your FastComments Tenant is in Good Standing!
tenant-deactivation-cancelled.DETAILS_LINE_ONE: This is an automated email. We see that you have updated your billing information.
tenant-deactivation-cancelled.DETAILS_LINE_TWO: Your account is no longer scheduled for deactivation. Thank you for your business!

tenant-deactivation-reactivated.SUBJECT: Your FastComments Tenant Has Been Reactivated!
tenant-deactivation-reactivated.DETAILS_LINE_ONE: This is an automated email. We see that you have updated your billing information.
tenant-deactivation-reactivated.DETAILS_LINE_TWO: Your tenant has been re-activated. Thank you for your business!

tenant-domain-added-notification.SUBJECT: Site Added to Your FastComments Account
tenant-domain-added-notification.DOMAIN_ADDED_PARAGRAPH: A new domain has been used with your FastComments.com account. Since you are in trial period, we have automatically added this site for you as a convenience. This is an automated email.
tenant-domain-added-notification.SITE_ADDED_WAS: The new site we detected was: <%= domainAdded %>
tenant-domain-added-notification.TECHNICAL_DETAILS: FastComments authenticates requests to your account by domain. Sometimes, automated systems, bots, or translation tools can cause this to happen, and adding this domain to your account may not be desirable.
tenant-domain-added-notification.FLEX_BILLING_NOTE: Note: Since your account is using flex pricing, domains added incur a cost, with the first one being free. Check the amount for any future invoices here.
tenant-domain-added-notification.BILLING_NOTE: Note: Since your account is not using flex pricing, you can only have so many domains on your account. Check the usage of your plan here.
tenant-domain-added-notification.YOU_CAN_REMOVE_THIS_DOMAIN: If desired, you can remove this domain, as well as disable this feature.
tenant-domain-added-notification.OUTRO: If this site should belong to your account, no further action is needed. Thanks for using FastComments!

tenant-free-trial-expired-reminder.SUBJECT: FastComments Billing Issue

tenant-free-trial-expired-reminder.SIGN_IN_ENTER_BILLING_INFO: Sign in and Enter Payment Information

login.NEW_USER_SUBJECT: Welcome to FastComments <%= username %>! Verify & login to your account here

profile-comment-notification.SUBJECT: New profile comment from <%= comment.commenterName %>

tenant-deactivated.SUBJECT: Your FastComments Tenant Has Been Deactivated
tenant-deactivated.DETAILS_LINE_ONE: This is an automated email. We see that you have had outstanding invoices for some time, and have not been able to reach you. Your account has now been deactivated.
tenant-deactivated.DETAILS_LINE_TWO: No data has been deleted. You can always re-activate your account here.

tenant-deactivated-soon.SUBJECT: Your FastComments Tenant Will Be Deactivated Soon!
tenant-deactivated-soon.DETAILS_LINE_ONE: This is an automated email. We see that you have had outstanding invoices for some time, and have not been able to reach you.
tenant-deactivated-soon.DETAILS_LINE_TWO: Your account will be deactivated on <%= readableDeactivationDate %>. You can update your billing information here.

tenant-deactivation-cancelled.SUBJECT: Your FastComments Tenant is in Good Standing!
tenant-deactivation-cancelled.DETAILS_LINE_ONE: This is an automated email. We see that you have updated your billing information.
tenant-deactivation-cancelled.DETAILS_LINE_TWO: Your account is no longer scheduled for deactivation. Thank you for your business!

tenant-deactivation-reactivated.SUBJECT: Your FastComments Tenant Has Been Reactivated!
tenant-deactivation-reactivated.DETAILS_LINE_ONE: This is an automated email. We see that you have updated your billing information.
tenant-deactivation-reactivated.DETAILS_LINE_TWO: Your tenant has been re-activated. Thank you for your business!

tenant-domain-added-notification.SUBJECT: Site Added to Your FastComments Account
tenant-domain-added-notification.DOMAIN_ADDED_PARAGRAPH: A new domain has been used with your FastComments.com account. Since you are in trial period, we have automatically added this site for you as a convenience. This is an automated email.
tenant-domain-added-notification.SITE_ADDED_WAS: The new site we detected was: <%= domainAdded %>
tenant-domain-added-notification.TECHNICAL_DETAILS: FastComments authenticates requests to your account by domain. Sometimes, automated systems, bots, or translation tools can cause this to happen, and adding this domain to your account may not be desirable.
tenant-domain-added-notification.FLEX_BILLING_NOTE: Note: Since your account is using flex pricing, domains added incur a cost, with the first one being free. Check the amount for any future invoices here.
tenant-domain-added-notification.BILLING_NOTE: Note: Since your account is not using flex pricing, you can only have so many domains on your account. Check the usage of your plan here.
tenant-domain-added-notification.YOU_CAN_REMOVE_THIS_DOMAIN: If desired, you can remove this domain, as well as disable this feature.
tenant-domain-added-notification.OUTRO: If this site should belong to your account, no further action is needed. Thanks for using FastComments!

tenant-free-trial-expired-reminder.SUBJECT: FastComments Billing Issue

tenant-free-trial-expired-reminder.SIGN_IN_ENTER_BILLING_INFO: Sign in and Enter Payment Information

tenant-free-trial-half-done-reminder.SIGN_IN_ENTER_BILLING_INFO: Sign in and Enter Payment Information

login.VERIFY_YOUR_ACCOUNT_THIS_LINK: Please verify your account by clicking this link. This will also sign you in.
login.CAN_CREATE_NEW_LINKS_HERE: You can create new links to log into your account here.
login.CLICK_HERE_TO_LOGIN: Click here to login to FastComments.

profile-comment-notification.SUBJECT: New profile comment from <%= comment.commenterName %>
profile-comment-notification.YOU_HAVE_A_NEW_PROFILE_COMMENT: You have received a new comment on your profile, shown below. You can view your profile comments by clicking the button below.

tenant-comment-digest.VIEW_MORE_COMMENTS: Moderate <%= abbreviateNumber(commentCount - comments.length, 0, locale) %> more comments
tenant-comment-digest.CHANGE_FREQUENCY: Change the frequency of this email.

tenant-comment-notification.SUBJECT: <%= abbreviateNumber(commentCount, 0, locale) %> <% if(commentCount === 1) {%>New Comment<% } else { %>New Comments<% } %>
tenant-comment-notification.HERE_ARE_LINKS_TO_PAGES: Here are the links to the pages those comments are on, with the count of comments for each.

tenant-deactivated.SUBJECT: Your FastComments Tenant Has Been Deactivated
tenant-deactivated.DETAILS_LINE_ONE: This is an automated email. We see that you have had outstanding invoices for some time, and have not been able to reach you. Your account has now been deactivated.
tenant-deactivated.DETAILS_LINE_TWO: No data has been deleted. You can always re-activate your account here.

tenant-deactivated-soon.SUBJECT: Your FastComments Tenant Will Be Deactivated Soon!
tenant-deactivated-soon.DETAILS_LINE_ONE: This is an automated email. We see that you have had outstanding invoices for some time, and have not been able to reach you.
tenant-deactivated-soon.DETAILS_LINE_TWO: Your account will be deactivated on <%= readableDeactivationDate %>. You can update your billing information here.

tenant-deactivation-cancelled.SUBJECT: Your FastComments Tenant is in Good Standing!
tenant-deactivation-cancelled.DETAILS_LINE_ONE: This is an automated email. We see that you have updated your billing information.
tenant-deactivation-cancelled.DETAILS_LINE_TWO: Your account is no longer scheduled for deactivation. Thank you for your business!

tenant-deactivation-reactivated.SUBJECT: Your FastComments Tenant Has Been Reactivated!
tenant-deactivation-reactivated.DETAILS_LINE_ONE: This is an automated email. We see that you have updated your billing information.
tenant-deactivation-reactivated.DETAILS_LINE_TWO: Your tenant has been re-activated. Thank you for your business!

tenant-domain-added-notification.SUBJECT: Site Added to Your FastComments Account
tenant-domain-added-notification.DOMAIN_ADDED_PARAGRAPH: A new domain has been used with your FastComments.com account. Since you are in trial period, we have automatically added this site for you as a convenience. This is an automated email.
tenant-domain-added-notification.SITE_ADDED_WAS: The new site we detected was: <%= domainAdded %>
tenant-domain-added-notification.TECHNICAL_DETAILS: FastComments authenticates requests to your account by domain. Sometimes, automated systems, bots, or translation tools can cause this to happen, and adding this domain to your account may not be desirable.
tenant-domain-added-notification.FLEX_BILLING_NOTE: Note: Since your account is using flex pricing, domains added incur a cost, with the first one being free. Check the amount for any future invoices here.
tenant-domain-added-notification.BILLING_NOTE: Note: Since your account is not using flex pricing, you can only have so many domains on your account. Check the usage of your plan here.
tenant-domain-added-notification.YOU_CAN_REMOVE_THIS_DOMAIN: If desired, you can remove this domain, as well as disable this feature.
tenant-domain-added-notification.OUTRO: If this site should belong to your account, no further action is needed. Thanks for using FastComments!

tenant-free-trial-expired-reminder.SUBJECT: FastComments Billing Issue
tenant-free-trial-expired-reminder.FRIENDLY_REMINDER: This is a friendly reminder that your FastComments free trial HAS EXPIRED or you have a billing issue with your account.
tenant-free-trial-expired-reminder.SIGN_IN_ENTER_BILLING_INFO: Sign in and Enter Payment Information

tenant-free-trial-half-done-reminder.SUBJECT: FastComments Free Trial - 15 Days Left
tenant-free-trial-half-done-reminder.FRIENDLY_REMINDER: This is a friendly reminder that you are halfway through your FastComments free trial.
tenant-free-trial-half-done-reminder.COMMENTS_HAVE_BEEN_LEFT: <%= Number(commentCount).toLocaleString() %> comments have been left on your site(s).
tenant-free-trial-half-done-reminder.VOTES_GIVEN: There have been <%= Number(voteCount).toLocaleString() %> votes on those comments.
tenant-free-trial-half-done-reminder.USERS_SIGNED_UP: Last but not least, <%= Number(userCount).toLocaleString() %> users have signed up to use FastComments through <%= tenantName %>.
tenant-free-trial-half-done-reminder.SIGN_IN_ENTER_BILLING_INFO: Sign in and Enter Payment Information

tenant-new-user-invite.SUBJECT: You've been invited to join <%= tenantName %>!
tenant-new-user-invite.INVITE_DETAILS: You've been invited to join the FastComments tenant <%= tenantName %>. Accepting this invite will create an account for you with the following permissions:

tenant-user-invite.SUBJECT: You've been invited to join <%= tenantName %>!
tenant-user-invite.INVITE_DETAILS: You've been invited to join the tenant <%= tenantName %>. Accepting this invite will elevate your commenter account into an administrator account. <%= tenantName %> will have COMPLETE OWNERSHIP of your account including the ability to delete it. You'll have the following permissions:

tenant-user-removed-from-tenant.SUBJECT: You've Been Removed From <%= tenantName %>
tenant-user-removed-from-tenant.REMOVED_AS_ADMIN: It looks like you've been removed as a user from <%= tenantName %>. You will retain your FastComments account as a commenter, but you will no longer have access to <%= tenantName %>.

user-help-acknowledged.SUBJECT: Help Request Acknowledged By Support Staff
user-help-acknowledged.ACKNOWLEDGED_BY_ADMIN: Looks like the support agent with the username "<%= adminUsername %>" has acknowledged your request. They should reach out to you shortly.
user-help-acknowledged.DONT_REPLY_TO_THIS: This email comes from an outbound-only email box - don't reply to it. We'll reach out to you separately.

tenant-domain-added-notification.SUBJECT: Site Added to Your FastComments Account

badge-award.INTRO: Hey <%= username %>, you've earned a new badge!

badge-award.BADGE_EARNED_MESSAGE: You've successfully earned the <%= badge.name %> badge.

profile-comment-awaiting-approval.SUBJECT: Profile comment from <%= comment.commenterName %> awaiting approval
profile-comment-awaiting-approval.YOU_HAVE_A_PROFILE_COMMENT_AWAITING_APPR: You have received a new comment on your profile that requires your approval. You can approve or reject this comment using the buttons below.

comment-user-mention.SUBJECT: You've been tagged in a comment.

commenter-comment-notification.PAST_HOUR_COMMENT_COUNT: In the past hour you've had <% if(replyCount > 1) { %>some replies<% } else { %>a reply<% } %> to your<% if(commentsSummary.length > 1) {%> comments<% } else { %> comment<% } %>.
commenter-comment-notification.SUBJECT: <%= abbreviateNumber(replyCount, 0, locale) %> <% if(replyCount === 1) {%>New Reply<% } else { %>New Replies<% } %> to <% if(replyCount > 1) { %>Your Comments<% } else {%>Your Comment<% } %>
commenter-comment-notification.REPLY_BY_EMAIL_TIP: You can reply to this email directly to post your response.

commenter-verify-post.SUBJECT: <%= comment.commenterName %> - Verify your comment.
commenter-verify-post.LOOKS_LIKE_YOU_COMMENTED_HERE: This is an automated email. It looks like you commented on a post here. If you click the verification link below, it'll help us know that it was you that left this comment.
commenter-verify-post.WASNT_YOU_OR_REGRET: If this wasn't you or you regret what you said ignore this email and the comment will be removed in <%= removedInDays %> days.
commenter-verify-post.REMOVE_COMMENT: Remove This Comment

commenter-verify-vote.SUBJECT: <%= commenterName %> - Verify your Vote.
commenter-verify-vote.LOOKS_LIKE_YOU_VOTED_HERE: It looks like you voted on a post here. If you click the verification link below, it'll help us know that it was you that left this vote.
commenter-verify-vote.WAS_YOU_IGNORE_THIS_EMAIL: If this wasn't you then ignore this email.

commenter-welcome-from-comment.SUBJECT: Welcome to FastComments <%= comment.commenterName %>!
commenter-welcome-from-comment.LOOKS_LIKE_YOU_COMMENTED_HERE: It looks like you commented on a post here.

tenant-deactivated.SUBJECT: Your FastComments Tenant Has Been Deactivated
tenant-deactivated.DETAILS_LINE_ONE: This is an automated email. We see that you have had outstanding invoices for some time, and have not been able to reach you. Your account has now been deactivated.
tenant-deactivated.DETAILS_LINE_TWO: No data has been deleted. You can always re-activate your account here.

tenant-deactivated-soon.SUBJECT: Your FastComments Tenant Will Be Deactivated Soon!
tenant-deactivated-soon.DETAILS_LINE_ONE: This is an automated email. We see that you have had outstanding invoices for some time, and have not been able to reach you.
tenant-deactivated-soon.DETAILS_LINE_TWO: Your account will be deactivated on <%= readableDeactivationDate %>. You can update your billing information here.

tenant-deactivation-cancelled.SUBJECT: Your FastComments Tenant is in Good Standing!
tenant-deactivation-cancelled.DETAILS_LINE_ONE: This is an automated email. We see that you have updated your billing information.
tenant-deactivation-cancelled.DETAILS_LINE_TWO: Your account is no longer scheduled for deactivation. Thank you for your business!

tenant-deactivation-reactivated.SUBJECT: Your FastComments Tenant Has Been Reactivated!
tenant-deactivation-reactivated.DETAILS_LINE_ONE: This is an automated email. We see that you have updated your billing information.
tenant-deactivation-reactivated.DETAILS_LINE_TWO: Your tenant has been re-activated. Thank you for your business!

tenant-domain-added-notification.SUBJECT: Site Added to Your FastComments Account
tenant-domain-added-notification.DOMAIN_ADDED_PARAGRAPH: A new domain has been used with your FastComments.com account. Since you are in trial period, we have automatically added this site for you as a convenience. This is an automated email.
tenant-domain-added-notification.SITE_ADDED_WAS: The new site we detected was: <%= domainAdded %>
tenant-domain-added-notification.TECHNICAL_DETAILS: FastComments authenticates requests to your account by domain. Sometimes, automated systems, bots, or translation tools can cause this to happen, and adding this domain to your account may not be desirable.
tenant-domain-added-notification.FLEX_BILLING_NOTE: Note: Since your account is using flex pricing, domains added incur a cost, with the first one being free. Check the amount for any future invoices here.
tenant-domain-added-notification.BILLING_NOTE: Note: Since your account is not using flex pricing, you can only have so many domains on your account. Check the usage of your plan here.
tenant-domain-added-notification.YOU_CAN_REMOVE_THIS_DOMAIN: If desired, you can remove this domain, as well as disable this feature.
tenant-domain-added-notification.OUTRO: If this site should belong to your account, no further action is needed. Thanks for using FastComments!

commenter-verify-post.LOOKS_LIKE_YOU_COMMENTED_HERE: This is an automated email. It looks like you commented on a post here. If you click the verification link below, it'll help us know that it was you that left this comment.
commenter-verify-post.WASNT_YOU_OR_REGRET: If this wasn't you or you regret what you said ignore this email and the comment will be removed in <%= removedInDays %> days.
commenter-verify-post.REMOVE_COMMENT: Remove This Comment

commenter-verify-vote.SUBJECT: <%= commenterName %> - Verify your Vote.
commenter-verify-vote.LOOKS_LIKE_YOU_VOTED_HERE: It looks like you voted on a post here. If you click the verification link below, it'll help us know that it was you that left this vote.
commenter-verify-vote.WAS_YOU_IGNORE_THIS_EMAIL: If this wasn't you then ignore this email.

commenter-welcome-from-comment.SUBJECT: Welcome to FastComments <%= comment.commenterName %>!
commenter-welcome-from-comment.LOOKS_LIKE_YOU_COMMENTED_HERE: It looks like you commented on a post here.
commenter-welcome-from-comment.YOU_CAN_CREATE_LOGIN_LINKS_HERE: You can create new links to log into your account here.
commenter-welcome-from-comment.WASNT_YOU_OR_REGRET: If this wasn't you or you regret what you said ignore this email and the comment will be removed in <%= removedInDays %> days.
commenter-welcome-from-comment.REMOVE_COMMENT: If you'd like to remove this comment now, click here
commenter-welcome-from-comment.USING_NAME_YOU_SAID: Using the name "<%= comment.commenterName %>" you said:

commenter-welcome-from-vote.SUBJECT: Welcome to FastComments <%= commenterName %>!
commenter-welcome-from-vote.LOOKS_LIKE_YOU_VOTED_HERE: It looks like you voted on a post here.
commenter-welcome-from-vote.CREATE_NEW_LOGIN_LINKS_HERE: You can create new links to log into your account here.
commenter-welcome-from-vote.WASNT_YOU_IGNORE_EMAIL: If this wasn't you then ignore this email.

direct-message-notification.SUBJECT: New message from <%= comment.commenterName %>
direct-message-notification.YOU_HAVE_A_NEW_MESSAGE: You have received a new message, shown below. You can reply by replying to this email, or clicking the button below.

forgot-username.SUBJECT: FastComments - Your Username
forgot-username.HERES_YOUR_USERNAME: Here's your username! Keep in mind your username is case-sensitive.

login.NEW_USER_SUBJECT: Welcome to FastComments <%= username %>! Verify & login to your account here
login.SUBJECT: Here's your login link <%= username %>
login.NEW_USER_THANKS_FOR_SIGNING_UP: Thanks for signing up to FastComments.
login.VERIFY_YOUR_ACCOUNT_THIS_LINK: Please verify your account by clicking this link. This will also sign you in.
login.CAN_CREATE_NEW_LINKS_HERE: You can create new links to log into your account here.
login.CLICK_HERE_TO_LOGIN: Click here to login to FastComments.

password-reset-request.SUBJECT: Password Reset Request
password-reset-request.CAN_RESET_HERE: You can reset your password here.
password-reset-request.INFO: You requested a link to reset your password.

profile-comment-notification.SUBJECT: New profile comment from <%= comment.commenterName %>
profile-comment-notification.YOU_HAVE_A_NEW_PROFILE_COMMENT: You have received a new comment on your profile, shown below. You can view your profile comments by clicking the button below.

subscribed-page-notifications.SUBJECT: New Comments
subscribed-page-notifications.YOU_HAVE_NEW_NOTIFICATIONS_SUBSCRIBED_PA: There are new comments on pages you've subscribed to.
subscribed-page-notifications.HERE_ARE_LINKS_TO_PAGES: Here's a list of pages with the new comments. There are also links below to unsubscribe from a page if desired.
subscribed-page-notifications.CAN_VIEW_ALL_IN_ACCOUNT: You can see all your individual unread notifications in your account home.

tenant-comment-digest.VIEW_MORE_COMMENTS: Moderate <%= abbreviateNumber(commentCount - comments.length, 0, locale) %> more comments
tenant-comment-digest.CHANGE_FREQUENCY: Change the frequency of this email.

tenant-comment-notification.SUBJECT: <%= abbreviateNumber(commentCount, 0, locale) %> <% if(commentCount === 1) {%>New Comment<% } else { %>New Comments<% } %>
tenant-comment-notification.HERE_ARE_LINKS_TO_PAGES: Here are the links to the pages those comments are on, with the count of comments for each.

tenant-deactivated.SUBJECT: Your FastComments Tenant Has Been Deactivated
tenant-deactivated.DETAILS_LINE_ONE: This is an automated email. We see that you have had outstanding invoices for some time, and have not been able to reach you. Your account has now been deactivated.
tenant-deactivated.DETAILS_LINE_TWO: No data has been deleted. You can always re-activate your account here.

tenant-deactivated-soon.SUBJECT: Your FastComments Tenant Will Be Deactivated Soon!
tenant-deactivated-soon.DETAILS_LINE_ONE: This is an automated email. We see that you have had outstanding invoices for some time, and have not been able to reach you.
tenant-deactivated-soon.DETAILS_LINE_TWO: Your account will be deactivated on <%= readableDeactivationDate %>. You can update your billing information here.

tenant-deactivation-cancelled.SUBJECT: Your FastComments Tenant is in Good Standing!
tenant-deactivation-cancelled.DETAILS_LINE_ONE: This is an automated email. We see that you have updated your billing information.
tenant-deactivation-cancelled.DETAILS_LINE_TWO: Your account is no longer scheduled for deactivation. Thank you for your business!

tenant-deactivation-reactivated.SUBJECT: Your FastComments Tenant Has Been Reactivated!
tenant-deactivation-reactivated.DETAILS_LINE_ONE: This is an automated email. We see that you have updated your billing information.
tenant-deactivation-reactivated.DETAILS_LINE_TWO: Your tenant has been re-activated. Thank you for your business!

tenant-domain-added-notification.SUBJECT: Site Added to Your FastComments Account
tenant-domain-added-notification.DOMAIN_ADDED_PARAGRAPH: A new domain has been used with your FastComments.com account. Since you are in trial period, we have automatically added this site for you as a convenience. This is an automated email.
tenant-domain-added-notification.SITE_ADDED_WAS: The new site we detected was: <%= domainAdded %>
tenant-domain-added-notification.TECHNICAL_DETAILS: FastComments authenticates requests to your account by domain. Sometimes, automated systems, bots, or translation tools can cause this to happen, and adding this domain to your account may not be desirable.
tenant-domain-added-notification.FLEX_BILLING_NOTE: Note: Since your account is using flex pricing, domains added incur a cost, with the first one being free. Check the amount for any future invoices here.
tenant-domain-added-notification.BILLING_NOTE: Note: Since your account is not using flex pricing, you can only have so many domains on your account. Check the usage of your plan here.
tenant-domain-added-notification.YOU_CAN_REMOVE_THIS_DOMAIN: If desired, you can remove this domain, as well as disable this feature.
tenant-domain-added-notification.OUTRO: If this site should belong to your account, no further action is needed. Thanks for using FastComments!

tenant-free-trial-expired-reminder.SUBJECT: FastComments Billing Issue
tenant-free-trial-expired-reminder.FRIENDLY_REMINDER: This is a friendly reminder that your FastComments free trial HAS EXPIRED or you have a billing issue with your account.
tenant-free-trial-expired-reminder.SIGN_IN_ENTER_BILLING_INFO: Sign in and Enter Payment Information

tenant-free-trial-half-done-reminder.SUBJECT: FastComments Free Trial - 15 Days Left
tenant-free-trial-half-done-reminder.FRIENDLY_REMINDER: This is a friendly reminder that you are halfway through your FastComments free trial.
tenant-free-trial-half-done-reminder.COMMENTS_HAVE_BEEN_LEFT: <%= Number(commentCount).toLocaleString() %> comments have been left on your site(s).
tenant-free-trial-half-done-reminder.VOTES_GIVEN: There have been <%= Number(voteCount).toLocaleString() %> votes on those comments.
tenant-free-trial-half-done-reminder.USERS_SIGNED_UP: Last but not least, <%= Number(userCount).toLocaleString() %> users have signed up to use FastComments through <%= tenantName %>.
tenant-free-trial-half-done-reminder.SIGN_IN_ENTER_BILLING_INFO: Sign in and Enter Payment Information

tenant-new-user-invite.SUBJECT: You've been invited to join <%= tenantName %>!
tenant-new-user-invite.INVITE_DETAILS: You've been invited to join the FastComments tenant <%= tenantName %>. Accepting this invite will create an account for you with the following permissions:

tenant-user-invite.SUBJECT: You've been invited to join <%= tenantName %>!
tenant-user-invite.INVITE_DETAILS: You've been invited to join the tenant <%= tenantName %>. Accepting this invite will elevate your commenter account into an administrator account. <%= tenantName %> will have COMPLETE OWNERSHIP of your account including the ability to delete it. You'll have the following permissions:

tenant-user-removed-from-tenant.SUBJECT: You've Been Removed From <%= tenantName %>
tenant-user-removed-from-tenant.REMOVED_AS_ADMIN: It looks like you've been removed as a user from <%= tenantName %>. You will retain your FastComments account as a commenter, but you will no longer have access to <%= tenantName %>.

user-help-acknowledged.SUBJECT: Help Request Acknowledged By Support Staff
user-help-acknowledged.ACKNOWLEDGED_BY_ADMIN: Looks like the support agent with the username "<%= adminUsername %>" has acknowledged your request. They should reach out to you shortly.
user-help-acknowledged.DONT_REPLY_TO_THIS: This email comes from an outbound-only email box - don't reply to it. We'll reach out to you separately.
